thread.title: Area Roundup 9-30-15: Sultana girls tennis gets first win of season
thread.title_full: Area Roundup 9-30-15: Sultana girls tennis gets first win of season

author: Staff Reports
title: Area Roundup 9-30-15: Sultana girls tennis gets first win of season
text: Posted Sep. 30, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:02 PM Posted Sep. 30, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:02 PM » Social News HESPERIA — Sultana girls tennis picked up its first win of the season on Wednesday, taking down Academy for Academic Excellence 16-1.. Sultana No. 1 singles player Neydi Vargas swept 6-3, 7-5, 6-1 while the No. 1 doubles team of Katie Williams-Morgan McDonald won 6-1, 6-2, 6-2. Sultana hosts Hesperia on Thursday. AAE SINGLES Samp 3-6, 6-3, 2-6; McKinney 5-7, 2-6, 3-6; Hanson 1-6, 2-6, 3-6. AAE DOUBLES Penatello-Rogado 1-6, 4-6; Bilbee-Servantec 2-6; Lamb-Sooter 3-6, 0-6; H. Pineda-Hutzley 2-6; Lovingood-A. Pineda 2-6, 6-4; Kim-A. Pineda 3-6. SULTANA SINGLES Vargas 6-3, 7-5, 6-1; A. Johnson 3-6, 6-2, 6-2; L. Johnson 6-2, 6-3, 6-3. SULTANA DOUBLES C. Williams-McDonald 6-1, 6-2, 6-2; Baker-D. Williams 6-4, 6-3, 6-3; Farias-Gomez 6-2, 6-0, 4-6. PREP GIRLS TENNIS Apple Valley 12, Hesperia 6 At Hesperia, the Scorpions dropped a Mojave River League match on Tuesday. Hesperia (1-6 MRL) plays at Sultana on Thursday. APPLE VALLEY SINGLES Corey 6-1, 6-1, 6-0; Hathaway 2-6, 6-7 (3), 6-3; Sanchez 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 APPLE VALLEY DOUBLES Webb-Conrad 6-1, 6-0, 6-1; Acosta-Fernandez 2-6, 7-6 (1), 6-3; Aguilar-Stine 2-6; Aguilar-Gregorian 7-6 (5), 0-6 HESPERIA SINGLES M. Smith 1-6, 6-2, 6-3; K. Smith 1-6, 7-6 (3), 1-6; Ruvacalba 0-6, 3-6, 4-6. HESPERIA DOUBLES Connolly-Aguilar 1-6, 6-2, 6-2; Vasquez-Chum 0-6, 6-7 (1), 6-7 (5); Salgado-Garcia 1-6, 6-0; Espinoza-Garcia 3-6 PREP GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Serrano 3, Sultana 0 At Hesperia, the Diamondbacks improved to 2-0 with a sweep on the road against the Sultans. Serrano topped Sultana 25-19, 25-23, 25-20 Sedona Hansen led the way with six kills and five digs, Jenna Compton added five kills and two digs, Carly Aigner-Swesey contributed 20 assists and Sawyer Aigner-Swesey chipped in with 10 digs. Sultana coach Dwayne Wibeto said he was happy with how his team hung with the defending Mojave River League champs. “We played solid defense,” Wibeto said. “Going into it, we know Serrano is the team to beat in our league. We came out and we competed well. We had a few errors that we could take away and we are right there.” Tayler Miller and Ryley Moore each had eight kills for the Sultans. Moore added three blocks. Jenna Mendenhall put up 28 assists, Hannah Gaaf added 21 digs, Kayla Lugo had six kills and four blocks and Hailey Sauer contributed 15 digs. Sultana (9-3, 1-1 MRL) travels to play Hesperia on Monday while Serrano (13-1, 2-0 MRL) hosts Oak Hills the same day. Apple Valley 3, Hesperia 0 At Apple Valley, MacKenzie Goodrow served 20 straight times in the second set as the Sun Devils swept the Scorpions. Apple Valley won 25-13, 25-2, 25-17. Goodrow helped spur the 25-2 score in the second set. She finished the night with three aces, eight kills, 18 assists and 10 digs. Courtney Chew had 10 kills and three blocks; Kaitlyn Jones added three aces, five kills and 17 digs; Alex Parisian had an ace, four kills, two blocks and 15 digs; and Alex Rozhon four aces and 11 assists. Apple Valley (13-2, 1-1 Mojave River League) will host Burroughs on Monday. Burroughs 3, Oak Hills 0 At Ridgecrest, the Bulldogs dropped their second Mojave River League match of the season. Oak Hills fell 15-25, 14-25 and 15-25. Megan Ehlers grabbed four blocks, 15 assists and one ace; Heidi Kim had 11 digs and a pair of aces; Lizzie Uelese posted seven kills and six blocks Oak Hills (8-4, 0-2 MRL) plays at Serrano on Thursday. By Staff Reports
